chart: What is the average income per person per year?
description: GNI (2015 US$) per capita.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank World Development Indicators, series code NY.GNP.PCAP.CD.

chart: How much does the government spend per person?
description: Government spending per person, 2015 PPP$. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.

chart: How is income distributed?
description: Percentage of income received by each quintile of the population. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20, SI.DST.02ND.20, SI.DST.03RD.20, SI.DST.04TH.20 and SI.DST.05TH.20.

chart: What is the population in year = x?
description: Total population.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.TOTL.

chart: What is the urban vs rural split?
description: Urban vs rural population level.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS, SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS.

chart: What is the age profile?
description: Number of people in each of 3 age bands.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.0014.TO.ZS, SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS and SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS.

chart: As a share of GNI, how much aid does UK allocate?
description: NULL (for now).
source: NULL (for now).

chart: How have resource outflows changed over time?
description: Estimates of international resource flows from developed countries, 2015 US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data of some flows is missing. Development finance institutions: Development Initiatives calculations based on a review of DFIs' annual reports (with flows reported as ODA or OOFs subtracted). Foreign direct investment: OECD. Disbursements of official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook.

chart: What's the mix of resources in year = x?
description: Estimates of international resource flows from developed countries, 2015 US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data of some flows is missing. Development finance institutions: Development Initiatives calculations based on a review of DFIs' annual reports (with flows reported as ODA or OOFs subtracted). Foreign direct investment: OECD. Disbursements of official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook.

chart: Inflows vs outflows
description: Estimates of international resource flows from developed countries, 2015 US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data of some flows is missing. Development finance institutions: Development Initiatives calculations based on a review of DFIs' annual reports (with flows reported as ODA or OOFs subtracted). Foreign direct investment: OECD. Disbursements of official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook.

chart: How many of the poorest people globally live in country = x?
description: NULL (for now).
source: NULL (for now).

chart: What resources are available? Domestic public
description: Non-grant government revenue. Data is for 2015.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Staff reports.

chart: What resources are available? International
description: Estimates of international resource flows into the country, 2015 US$. Estimates are gross inflows where available, with the following exceptions: foreign direct investment and portfolio equity are net inflows (new investments minus disinvestments) and short-term debt is net flows (disbursements minus capital repayments). See methodology for detailed notes on the data for each resource flow.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data on some flows are missing. Official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Foreign direct investment: UNCTAD Stats. Long- and short-term debt: World Bank International Debt Statistics. Portfolio equity: World Bank data bank. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Data.

chart: How much does the government spend per person?
description: Government spending per person, 2015 PPP$. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.

chart: Is poverty reducing over time?
description: Percentage of population living under $1.90 per day.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet.

chart: How deep is poverty?
description: Depth of extreme poverty (also known as the poverty gap) tells us how far people are from the extreme poverty line, on average per country.
source: World Bank PovcalNet.

chart: How is income distributed?
description: Percentage of income received by each quintile of the population. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20, SI.DST.02ND.20, SI.DST.03RD.20, SI.DST.04TH.20 and SI.DST.05TH.20.
